fields.description:
We lost them during the breadcrumb rewrite.

If we dont want icons, then some other indicator
fields.summary: Disable icons in breadcrumbs

fields.description: Currently all you get is "0 tests failed" would be cool to know if merge or push failed on hover.
fields.summary: Hitsory Navigator tool tip should say if merge failed

fields.description: This should actually be 30 minute for the Job. This will need to be fixed up in Bamboo as well
fields.summary: JBAM - If continuing a build, remaining time is not accurate

fields.description: + limit to 7 chars and linked to WebRepo
fields.summary: JBAM - Revision in JBAM plugin should be in the new lozene format
JBAM - Builds in the release tabs with labels should show them

fields.description:
When there is no password set for the GitHub repository, Bamboo prompts for a password in the console where it throws the logs. After hitting enter, Bamboo starts the build.

There shouldn't be any password prompt if the password field is empty.
fields.summary: Bamboo prompts to type a password if the password field for GitHub repository configuration is empty
Reset Password should redirect to Crowd server, when using Crowd for user management

fields.description:
from [https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/40180/support-github-pull-request-notifications-in-bamboo-to-implement-gated-check-ins]

Bamboo 4.0 will support branch-by-branch workflows in hg/git - the developer can 'fork' the mainline branch into his/her personal branch, work, and ask Bamboo to act as gatekeeper between personal branch and the mainline branch.

However, some people might want to work by forking the whole repo, commit to that personal repo, and ask Bamboo to act as gatekeeper between the personal repo and the mainline repo. This use-case is more probable in environments where strong policies are enforced (like for example casual developer has no 'push' access to the mainline repo, nor the admin access to the Bamboo).

{color:gray}note, that it should be possible to achieve the branch-by-fork workflow utilizing Bamboo 4.0 facilities, but it wouldn't be so straight out-of-the-box, and would force the casual developer has admin access to the Bamboo admin. A few things that we should keep in mind if we implement this story:
* automatic detection of forks (probably not doable outside of Github & Bitbucket)
* merging the same branch, but on two different repositoryUrls{color}
fields.summary: Support detecting and building forks from Github, Bitbucket Cloud and Bitbucket Server

fields.description:
Currently there is no easy way to disable a bunch of branches at once.  This means that you can't ever turn off all the builds (like we recommend in several info boxes) before performing volatile actions (e.g. export, plan move etc.)

Or even if you just dont want them to talk to your vcs...
fields.summary: Provide way bulk disable branches

fields.description: It really needs to not look like a branch, especially because we are using the same term for all repository types.
fields.summary: "default" should stand out more in branch selector

fields.description: Currently its only possible to run the Merge Strategy when the plan has completed. It might be reasonable only to merge when a plan has reached a particular stage.
fields.summary: Configure what stage the branch merge strategy should run on
Showing last X builds dropdown on Agent page hidden in header

fields.description:
Currently the logs read:

05-Mar-2012 05:19:02	Error occurred while executing the build for J50SHIPIT-ODAT-JOB1-8 : Task failed since repository with id 172589290 does not exist. It may have been deleted, please update the task and pick a new repository

We should use the name of the repository instead of the id.

*Generally, we should NEVER use ID's in the UI because they are not useful to users.*
fields.summary: Use repository name instead of ID in log error message

fields.description: The latest changes are not being checked out.
fields.summary: SVN branching task prior to SVN checkout doesn't get picked up

fields.description: Would be cool if quarantined tests in 'master' plan would also result in being quarantined in child plan-branches. For example we have those two SAL tests failing on tardigrade now, and if I work on feature-branches and use "gatekeeper" in Bamboo for them - I have to manually quarantine those two SAL tests in my BambooBranch too. Would be cool if I didn't have and the Bamboo would guess that those two SAL tests can fail and Bamboo can push to master (gatekeeper) if no other tests fail.
fields.summary: Quarantine tests across branches

fields.description:
* time box this to 2 days
* This is apparently straight forward to hookup according to Sam and Adrian
* Backs up rows to xml
fields.summary: Import/Export for ActiveObjects

fields.description: Issue created should show up in the "Related Issues" of a result.
fields.summary: Created issue should be linked in Bamboo
HipChat build notifications
User can see a list of builds they are responsible for on the My Bamboo tab
Create a JIRA issue to track the build without having to assign it to a user
When assigning responsibility, allow the creation of a new JIRA issue to track the responsibility

fields.description: Being able to "test" a plan, without it saving the results or artifacts, but simply a "pass or fail" state would be a nice feature to have. This would allow admins to make changes to a plan, it's scripts, or even the repository and manually run the plan to see if it completes without errors. A "Run Test" option could be added to the run pulldown button on the plans. At the end, it would display a result page letting you see whether or not the build passed or failed, and the logs associated with it. Ideally a "Run Test" would display the same results page as a normal run would, except that the build number would not be incrimented for the overall plan, and the results/artifacts would be discarded.
fields.summary: Test a plan
mvn:deploy a final version of all EC2 images on prod account before release
Update Changes page with new changes table style
Update Changes page with new changes table style

fields.description:
My notification set for my branches have nothing in them, despite the creation code adding them.

When i added a second notification to be added, the first notification was persisted and the second one wasn't.

Using hsql db
fields.summary: Branch Notification Set not always persisted

fields.description:
The default elastic agent for windows has a build-dir of:

C:\Users\Bamboo\bamboo-agent-home\xml-data\build-dir\

54 chars long.  This can cause problems for projects that also have deeply nested files, causing delete operations to fail and all sorts of other muck.

Would be better to mount the build-dir to x:\ or something similar to help avoid long path problems on windows.
fields.summary: Default elastic bamboo windows agent build-dir path is nested too deep
Provide remote triggering for manual stages
Expose Agent information via REST API

fields.description: Tricky... Possibly the artifact definition should be rewritten after build.
fields.summary: Automated Clover artifact creation does not take into account task working directories

fields.description: Any of the tasks (worse, more than one task) can create the Clover output that the user intends to parse. With the current plugin we are not able to handle that, we just grab whatever is available.
fields.summary: It should be possible to specify the task that creates the clover output during plugin configuration

fields.description: if a customer uses a working directory, automated integration will not work.
fields.summary: Automated Clover integration does not take into account task working directories

fields.description:
Currently, the remote agent accepts the url on command line, but still uses the one from the configuration file. This is very misleading.
I think we should use the one from command line as a non-persistent override for config. If no URL is supplied, we should use the one from config.
"Install" action should do what it used to.
fields.summary: Make remote agent startup more intuitive

fields.description:
If a JIRA issue has been created from a build result, we should copy comments made in one place to the other.  Eg...
- comments made on a build results summary page are automatically added to any corresponding JIRA issue/s
- comments made on a JIRA issue are automatically added to the corresponding build's result summary
fields.summary: Bi-directional commenting in JIRA issues created from build results
Add an option in Bamboo allowing to use Request URL (instead of Base URL) permanently for all requests.

fields.description:
race condition in the watchdog - is terminating images, if the agent doesn't start-up in time.

Basically, the watchdog script has to be modified
the fix will involve copying a fixed version from the EBS
watchdog shouldn't kill machines with uptime less that ~40 minutes
because we pay for every started hour anyway
and that will be the fix
fields.summary: Elastic Image watchdog is misbehaving

fields.description: see discussion in [BSP-6666|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/BSP-6666]. Generally it might be a good idea to bypass the SSH proxy sometimes, for example to increase speed of checkouts. Or when the SSH proxy malfunctions.
fields.summary: Option in GitRepository to allow disabling/bypassing the bamboo ssh proxy.

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce the problem:
1. User commits to svn repo X with rev 232
2. Two years later - user commits to a new svn repo Y with a resulting rev 232.
3. Bamboo shows both #1 and #2 because if does:
   a) Queries to find the latest revs and picks up #2
   b) Retrieves any builds with revision 232
fields.summary: My Bamboo assumes that revision numbers are unique across all repositories

fields.description:
i created a maven build task that produces test and specified a custom test results directory

attempting to specify an absolute path (e.g. {{/path/to/target/outside/of/JOB/surefire-reports/*.xml}}) does not appear to be working.

bamboo appears to be searching in {{/path/to/JOB/}} for my tests, even though i specify an absolute path.

how can this be resolved, or is it even possible? we would like to know if this is possible, as we do not have much time left to evaluate bamboo :(

thanks
fields.summary: Maven test results directory not using correct path

fields.description:
ArtifactLinkMapper, ConsumedSubscriptionMapper are deadly slow.
Most probably due to use of buildResultsSummaryManager to fetch ResultSummaries.
We need to consider using:
- specialized query to fetch only id of ResultSummary
- dummy objects to be used in associations
- fixed-size cache to eliminate too frequent DB hits
fields.summary: ArtifactLinkMapper, ConsumedSubscriptionMapper are deadly slow

fields.description: On the admin page, I'd like to see (near the top) a easy way to pause/unpause the server. Other views (like the upm) can still include this on the header of their views, but as an admin I shouldn't need to think "oh I need to pause the server, let me load the plugin manager view, as I know it has pause feature on the top).
fields.summary: Make server pause/unpause more general purpose

fields.description: When looking at user details, the source repository aliases information shows up with html encoded entities.
fields.summary: Source repository alias details show html encoded entities and should really show the proper text

Bamboo fails to show the Git revision:

!bamboo rev.png!

fields.summary: Git revision not shown for plan

fields.description:
Notification events are a nice way to collect terse history of what the server is actually doing, but some more information would be nice...

Would like to see some more system notification events:

* server paused/resumed
* server started/shutting down

Would like to see plan/job events:

* plan build started/stopped
* job build started/stopped

I'm mostly interested in plan started, since some plans could take many many hours, I'd like to get a simple notification when this happens.

Would also like to see other notification events:

* elastic agent instance started/stopped/failed
* elastic agent running/stopped/failed

Might also be interesting to make a generic notification task, so that a particular job workflow could emit its own custom notifications.
fields.summary: Add more system/other notification events
Provide more descriptive errors for UPM (Universal Plugin Manager)

fields.description:
We have SVN load balanced, so responses from it get returned from multiple IP addresses. Not having the ability to specify more than one IP to trigger a build is a HUGE pain.

Because of this, we're forced to use frequent repository polling (which results in 100s of periodic "Unable to connect to SVN repository" errors), or do a bunch of Apache magic to proxy requests to come from one vserver.

(...and thankfully we're using Apache, instead of something else where it may not be so easy to do that. Like, say, svn+ssh.)

Sorry guys, but the "security" excuse is wearing thin - seems easy enough to just whitelist - accept originating IP requests from whatever IPs we type in, and exclude all others.

- It doesn't even have to accept globs or wildcards, but the field length should be plenty long enough to accept multiple (comma separated) server names.

- It shouldn't matter whether it's an IP address or DNS entry, but for now it's easy enough for us to ping.

- Especially since you support Git, having the ability to accept build triggers from multiple IPs should absolutely be included.
fields.summary: Multiple IPs for Build Trigger Not Recognized

fields.description:
Bamboo source doens't compile as Maven can't pull down install4j libraries.
The customer needs to comment out <module>bamboo-installer</module> from components/pom.xml.

We should have a different profile for building Bamboo source to exclude thirdparty libraries from compilation
fields.summary: Building Bamboo Source fails due to Install4j

Two options:
Default (committers only)
Inherit parent plans notifications

add a read-only view of what the parents notifications are in the UI to avoid going back to the plan

option to notify only the creator of the branch (personal branch case)
fields.summary: Notifications for Plan Branches
Change "Complete Branch Listing" into "View all Branches" in the Branches drop-down.
Provide a way to get back to the Plan Branches splash from the Branches tab
Merge Strategy "default" should be labeled default
Rename Integration Strategy to Merge Strategy
Integration Strategy UI is broken for longer field names
Better description for Repository Settings commit master, warning for when it doesn't include [Bamboo] and merging could go into infinite loop.
Remove Last Updated by for Branches since this is duplicated by Result History.
Plugin tabs do not work with the Pushstate

fields.description: Suggestion: Snapshot the branch names on the build result so they don't get screwed up.
fields.summary: Show "merging from default to mybranch" next to revision id for Branch Integration Details
Use orange "did not build"/"did not happen" icon and text description for Branch Integration Details
Disable buttons when creating branch.
Show X out of Y branches on Branch Creation dialog

fields.description:
If I have a build -> test -> deploy-acceptance-testing (manual) -> release (manual) plan in Bamboo now… there is no way to run the release stage w/o the deploy-acceptance-testing stage having run. 

I can see that we might want to have some manual stages which are optional. 

I could implement this as a separate plan, though its nicer to keep them together to share the scm information and other related configuration + ability to clone for a new project with ease/simplicity.
fields.summary: Ability to skip manual stage

fields.description:
When an elastic agent is starting up, it should log all remote URI details (like the broker's URI and the http[s] server's URI clearly and early in the process.

This should help in debugging invalid configuration (when https is required, but global server configuration has baseurl set to http value, etc).
fields.summary: Elastic agent should log all remote URI details as INFO

fields.description:
In my environment I am using a split public and private network for elastic agents to be launched into.  Users need secure access to the server via https, but elastic agents can securely access the server via http (due to vpc muck).

The baseUrl given to the elastic agents should be configurable and not simply use the configured global base url which the server is configured with.
fields.summary: Allow configuration of the baseUrl given to elastic agents.

fields.description: Would like to be able to disable a task, w/o removing its configuration, similar to how a job can be disabled.
fields.summary: Allow task to be disabled (similar to job)

fields.description:
Some plan variables need to be customized for a build to function properly.  Plans should allow variables to be marked as such and force "Run Customized".

Similarly some variables should not be customizable by "Run Customized" and should be marked as immutable.
fields.summary: Allow variables to be marked as required or immutable

fields.description:
Say you have the following scenario:

 # Build is green
 # Someone triggers a new execution and it fails.
 # Someone triggers another execution and it passes.

Now take another scenario:

 # Build is green
 # Someone triggers a new execution and it fails.
 # Someone reruns the failed execution and it passes.

Let's say that the user has the "failed builds and first successful" notification scheme enabled. In the first scenario users will be notified both upon the failure and upon the success. In the second scenario they will only be notified upon the failure - because the "first success" follows a "successful execution" (since the failure was only a rerun).

This has fooled me several times as I use email notifications to determine our build health. I'll see that the most recent of our email notifications all say "xxx has FAILED", but then when I go to BEAC, everything is green.
fields.summary: "build successful upon retry" scenario is not included in "Failed builds and first successful" notification scheme

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1) grab a windows machine
2) install there minimal git: [http://code.google.com/p/msysgit/]
3) grab Bamboo 3.4.3 (I think this error will still occur on newer versions too)
4) set up a Plan that uses Git as repository and uses ssh:// protocol, for example:
4.1) url = ssh://git@github.com/atlassian/bamboo-git-plugin.git
(use SSH keyfile as "authentication type" - set up your github account accordingly)
5) use the windows machine from point (1) as a remote agent, connect to bamboo
6) in bamboo administration - set up the remote agent to use Git capability (so it will use native-git checkout instead of jgit checkout)
7) run the plan
8a) observed behavior is that the build hangs at code checkout (possibly to localhost proxy-SSH fingerprint host key checking)
8b) while expected behavior is that the build will... build.

from: [BSP-6565|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/BSP-6565]
and: [https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/39371/ssh-port-on-git-repository-polling]
fields.summary: Bamboo Git Plugin (native mode) shouldn't hang when using ssh protocol on windows.

fields.description: Please add functionality to choose an agent to run a build from the list of the agents that are capable to run the specific build.
fields.summary: Provide functionality to choose an agent to run a build

fields.description: It would really help us in our project & plan administration if we would have the ability to add project specific variables (in addition to Global and Plan variables). The variables should be available to all plans in the project.
fields.summary: Project variables
"Gatekeeper" is one word

fields.description:
It looks like the company is moving towards not supporting xml in our REST Endpoints.  I think Bamboo should do the same (one day).

We should at least consider deprecating the XML support sooner rather than later, so that when that one day comes we can remove it.

JSON is much easier to parse and user, as well as all our mappers being slightly less finicky about json
fields.summary: Rest End points to only support JSON

fields.description: We should not wrap the build number when displayed next to the status icon. See attachment.
fields.summary: Recent Build table wraps build numbers
2 IP addresses added into Bamboo DB if remote agents are behind a proxy
Current Bamboo implementation should store the proxy IPs in the DB (separate from Remote Agent IPs)

fields.description:
Upgrade task 2806 carries out the conversion of column type from TEXT to VARCHAR. However, when using MySQL as DB one might encounter following error in the logs:
{noformat}
ERROR [main] [SchemaUpdate] Unsuccessful: create index commit_rev_idx on USER_COMMIT (COMMIT_REVISION)
ERROR [main] [SchemaUpdate] BLOB/TEXT column 'COMMIT_REVISION' used in key specification without a key length
{noformat}
After next Bamboo restart the indices will re-create correctly.

It would be cool if, we add something to 3.4.5 so:
* at the end of upgrade logs there would be a pretty obvious message (about the necessary Bamboo restart)
* in admin screen there would be proper information if Bamboo detects the non-existence of the index

see: BAM-10090, [BSP-6626|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/BSP-6626] for the details.
fields.summary: upgrade task 2806 improvements (better logs/informations)

fields.description:
If I set up a plan with "clean working directory after each build" or "Force Clean Build", and set up a script task containing git commands that address remotes, such as 'git merge-base origin/master', the task will fail with the error:

fatal: Not a valid object name origin/master

If I don't force the clean, I can hack the .git/config file in the task's build dir to contain the remote information, but this is a total hack, not a solution.
fields.summary: git repository should work with commands commands that reference remotes

fields.description: And i can't figure out how to turn it off....
fields.summary: The Feedback button is making my UI slow

fields.description:
We need to put a note in the Mercurial documentation to say that Bamboo does not support Mercurial 2.1 because the "pull" command does not return the right return code we need to update checkouts correctly.

We will support versions > 2.1.
fields.summary: Document that we do not support hg 2.1

fields.description:
Sometimes you still might want to see why the test failed even though its quarantined. 

Here is an example http://tardigrade.sydney.atlassian.com:8085/bamboo/browse/BAM-FC-7106/test of where you can't expand them
fields.summary: failed Quarantined Tests should be expandable on tests tab

fields.description:
And also maybe triggering auto detection.

Even if this only works for those autodetection capable repositories, where you can just set the vcs branch name.
fields.summary: Ability to create branches via rest

fields.description:
It would be nice to set an 'exclusive' checkbox for a stage so it doesn't run multiple times at once.

|| revision || a compile || b run unit tests || c deploy to int || d run integration tests ||
| 4 | running | | | |
| 3 | running | | | |
| 2 | done | done | awaiting rev 1 to finish stage c and d | |
| 1 | done | done | done | running |

While stages a and b can run in parallel, c and d can only run one revision at a time. In order to avoid collisions when deploying and running tests on the integration environment.
fields.summary: Make a stage or multiple stages exclusive and atomic so it will not run in parallel with other revisions

fields.description:
One of my builds frequently, but not always, fails with the following error:
com.atlassian.bamboo.repository.RepositoryException: Unable to retrieve source code to '8224' for 'TRUNK-ENTERPRSERV2': svn: Cannot create new file 'D:\bagt\build-dir\TRUNK-ENTERPRSERV2\Pmi.Services.Entities\Generic\Entities\.svn\lock'
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.repository.svn.SvnRepository.retrieveSourceCode(SvnRepository.java:421)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.v2.build.task.CheckoutUpdateForBuild.call(CheckoutUpdateForBuild.java:100)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.v2.build.agent.DefaultBuildAgent.build(DefaultBuildAgent.java:188)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.v2.build.agent.BuildAgentControllerImpl.waitAndPerformBuild(BuildAgentControllerImpl.java:90)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.v2.build.agent.DefaultBuildAgent$1.run(DefaultBuildAgent.java:101)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.build.pipeline.concurrent.NamedThreadFactory$1.run(NamedThreadFactory.java:33)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
Caused by: org.tmatesoft.svn.core.SVNException: svn: Cannot create new file 'D:\bagt\build-dir\TRUNK-ENTERPRSERV2\Pmi.Services.Entities\Generic\Entities\.svn\lock'
	at org.tmatesoft.svn.core.internal.wc.SVNErrorManager.error(SVNErrorManager.java:64)
	at org.tmatesoft.svn.core.internal.wc.SVNErrorManager.error(SVNErrorManager.java:51)

When this happens, there is no indication that the build failed, a log entry isn't even made.  we have several builds, but this problem only seems to occur in this one particular build and always at the same place.  Any help would be greatly appreciated.
fields.summary: SVN Checkout Issue

fields.description:
I wish I could select which agent will compile the given project.

For example:

I Project "A" and "B", I would like the project "A" compiled only on an agent, and the project "B" only compile the agent 2.

This could be done on the "Agent Matrix" in the Administration of Bamboo.
fields.summary: Select an agent for the project

fields.description:
Within a stage I'd like to be able to run the following jobs:

1 deploy website to integration environment
2 deploy database to integration environment

3 run selenium tests
4 run jmeter tests
5 run other integration tests

6 take down the website on the integration environment
7 take down the database on the integration environment

I would like to ensure 1 and 2 do not run in parallel, while 3,4 and 5 do. And even if one of the jobs 1-5 fail I would still like 6 and 7 to run.

The same configuration option that is present within a job would be nice for stage level. With the addition of 'initial jobs' or another way to avoid jobs to run in parallel.
fields.summary: Set 'initial jobs' and 'final jobs' within a stage that do not run in parallel and always execute

fields.description:
Within a stage I'd like to be able to run the following jobs:

1 deploy website to integration environment
2 deploy database to integration environment

3 run selenium tests
4 run jmeter tests
5 run other integration tests

6 take down the website on the integration environment
7 take down the database on the integration environment

I would like to ensure 1 and 2 do not run in parallel, while 3,4 and 5 do. And even if one of the jobs 1-5 fail I would still like 6 and 7 to run.

The same configuration option that is present within a job would be nice for stage level. With the addition of 'initial jobs' or another way to avoid jobs to run in parallel.
fields.summary: Set 'initial jobs' and 'final jobs' within a stage that do not run in parallel and always execute

fields.description:
i.e when you check the checkbox we should load all existing branches into the "branches I know about" list without actually creating them.  That way it will only auto create plan branches for NEW things.

This will solve the "i just turned it on and got 100 plan branches created" problem
fields.summary: When enabling auto detection - should only check for branches created after turning it on
Maven3 builders "full build log" launch details includes html making it hard to read/comprehend

fields.description: Please fix this as soon as possible. The [links|http://www.atlassian.com/software/bamboo/download-archives] are broken.
fields.summary: Links are broken on our web site for downloading Bamboo

fields.description: Why is TaskRequirementSupport removed in Bamboo 4.0? What impact does this have for existing Task plugins?
fields.summary: Why is TaskRequirementSupport removed in Bamboo 4.0?
Add support for SSL client certificates for Subversion repository support

fields.description:
Using:

{code}
                    <plugin>
                        <groupId>com.atlassian.bamboo.maven.sharing</groupId>
                        <artifactId>bamboo-artifact-sharing-maven-plugin</artifactId>
                        <version>3.3-m4-1</version>
                        <executions>
                            <execution>
                                <id>sharing</id>
                                <goals>
                                    <goal>share</goal>
                                </goals>
                            </execution>
                        </executions>
                    </plugin>
{code}

{code}

Docs state "Artifact sharing is configured differently when using Maven 2 or 3 as a builder for your Jobs." but there is no further details given here.

The docs for this feature are generally bad.  Its not clear what phase projects would need to execute for this to work, looking at the plugin.xml it looks like this will kick in during verify.

When its enabled, and bamboo* properties are not set, should really explain that its doing nothing.

Hopefully this feature will get move love in upcoming releases.

The docs also state "Note, the version number specified above (<version>) must match the version of Bamboo you are using" but from looking at the versions here:

* https://maven.atlassian.com/content/repositories/atlassian-public/com/atlassian/bamboo/maven/sharing/bamboo-artifact-sharing-maven-plugin/

... these versions don't tend to line up with any recent Bamboo release.
fields.summary: bamboo-artifact-sharing-maven-plugin in compatible with maven 3

fields.description:
Right now we show the builds in a linear way. Please provide new functionality to be able to see the relationship of revisions and stages in a pipeline view. Something like:
{code}
-----------------------------------------
            Stage-1   Stage-2   Stage-3
Revision-1  Passed    Passed    Failed

fields.description:
Sometimes an invalid character slips into a build definition XML and doesn't allow Bamboo server to start.

Please validate the XMLs before inserting into Bamboo DB.
fields.summary: Validate build definition XML files before saving them into the database

fields.summary: When branch configuration is changed (e.g. script body), the first run will use the old config, subsequent runs will use the new one
